sections.text: Tayammum replaces wudu' or ghusl whenever:

items: Water is scarce and needed for drinking, cooking, etc.
A person is ill or injured and fears harm from using water

sections.text: It takes the place of both minor (wudu') and major (ghusl) ablutions in these cases, enabling the person to pray as usual. Prayers offered with tayammum are not repeated once water becomes available.  However, if tayammum was done instead of ghusl, one must take a complete bath as soon as possible.  If a person cannot even perform tayammum, they should pray in their state of impurity rather than miss the prayer.

items: Niyyah (Intention): Form in the heart: “I intend to purify myself by tayammum for the sake of Allah.”.
Source: Strike both open palms once on any clean earth (sand, soil, stone, or dust).
Remove Excess: Gently blow off loose dust from the palms.
Wipe the Face: Pass both palms, one after the other, over the entire face once.
Wipe the Hands: Lay right palm over back of left hand and wipe up to the wrist; repeat for the other hand.
Tayammum covers both wudu' and ghusl in its valid cases
Prayers aren’t repeated when water returns
Must still take full ghusl as soon as possible if tayammum stood in for it
If even tayammum is impossible, pray anyway rather than skip
